Hexxagon.AI

Interface IBoardState

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BoardState

    public interface IBoardState
    Contains method specifications of state of board caused by alternate steps of players.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sandor Kalmanchey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte symbolOfEmptyCell
      Contains the value of a board cell when it active and not occupied by any player.
      static byte symbolOfFirstPlayer
      Contains the value of a board cell when it is occupied by first player.
      static byte symbolOfInactiveCell
      Contains the value of a board cell when it is inactive.
      static byte symbolOfSecondPlayer
      Contains the value of a board cell when it is occupied by second player.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getActiveCellCount()
      Retrieves the count of active cells.
      byte getActualPlayerIndex()
      Retrieves the the unique index of active player.
      byte[][] getBoard()
      Retrieves the board representing two dimensional array.
      byte getCellValue(int columnIndex, int rowIndex)
      Retrieves the value of the specified cell.

      Retrieves the count of unoccupied and active cells.

      Retrieves the the unique index of enemy player.

      Retrieves the count of balls of specified player.
      boolean isAnybodyHasNoBall()
      Answers whether is a player who has no ball left.
      boolean isBoardFull()
      Answers whether no more unoccupied cell remained on the board.

      Answers whether the requested cell is an active and not occupied one.

      Answers whether the requested cell exists or not.

      Answers whether the operator applied inside of the interval of the board.

      Answers whether the player has no ball left.

      Sets the value of the specified cell.

    • Method Detail

      • isThePlayerHasNoBall

        boolean isThePlayerHasNoBall(byte playerIndex)
                      throws TError
        Answers whether the player has no ball left.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - Unique index of player. It must not be in interval of 1-2 otherwise TError is thrown.
        Returns:
        True if the specified player has no more ball left on the board otherwise false
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.

      • isAnybodyHasNoBall

        boolean isAnybodyHasNoBall()
                    throws TError
        Answers whether is a player who has no ball left.
        Returns:
        True if there is at least one player who has no ball left on the board otherwise false.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.

      • isBoardFull

        boolean isBoardFull()
        Answers whether no more unoccupied cell remained on the board.
        Returns:
        True if there no more unoccupied cell otherwise false.

      • isCellOccupied

        boolean isCellOccupied(int columnIndex,
                       int rowIndex)
                throws TError
        Answers whether the specified cell is occupied.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The column index of the requested cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        rowIndex - The row index of the requested cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        Returns:
        True if the requested cell exists otherwise false.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.

      • getCellValue

        byte getCellValue(int columnIndex,
                  int rowIndex)
           throws TError
        Retrieves the value of the specified cell.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The column index of the requested cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        rowIndex - The row index of the requested cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        Returns:
        It is "-1" if cell is inactive. It is "0" if cell is active but not occupied. It is "1" if cell is occupied by first player. It is "2" if cell is occupied by second player.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.

      • setCellValue

        void setCellValue(int columnIndex,
                  int rowIndex,
                  byte value)
           throws TError
        Sets the value of the specified cell.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The column index of the cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        rowIndex - The row index of the cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        value - It can be "-1" if cell is inactive or "0" if cell is active but not occupied or "1" if cell is occupied by first player or "2" if cell is occupied by second player. In case of other values TError is thrown.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.

      • getBoard

        byte[][] getBoard()
        Retrieves the board representing two dimensional array.
        Returns:
        The reference to the array.

      • getPlayerBallCount

        int getPlayerBallCount(byte playerIndex)
                throws TError
        Retrieves the count of balls of specified player.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The index of the player. It must be 1 or 2 otherwise TError is thrown.
        Returns:
        0 or higher int value.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.

      • getActiveCellCount

        int getActiveCellCount()
        Retrieves the count of active cells. Active cells can be occupied or unoccupied.
        Returns:
        0 or higher int value.

      • getEmptyCellCount

        int getEmptyCellCount()
        Retrieves the count of unoccupied and active cells.
        Returns:
        0 or higher int value.

      • getActualPlayerIndex

        byte getActualPlayerIndex()
        Retrieves the the unique index of active player. Active player who is allowed to do the ongoing step.
        Returns:
        1 or 2 as value.

      • getEnemyPlayerIndex

        byte getEnemyPlayerIndex()
        Retrieves the the unique index of enemy player. Enemy player who is not allowed to do the ongoing step.
        Returns:
        1 or 2 as value.

      • isCellExists

        boolean isCellExists(int columnIndex,
                     int rowIndex)
        Answers whether the requested cell exists or not.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The column index of the cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        rowIndex - The row index of the cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        Returns:
        True if specified cell exists otherwise false.

      • isCellEmptyAndActive

        boolean isCellEmptyAndActive(int columnIndex,
                             int rowIndex)
                      throws TError
        Answers whether the requested cell is an active and not occupied one.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The column index of the cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        rowIndex - The row index of the cell. It must not be less than 0 and higher than than the highest index of board representing array otherwise TError is thrown.
        Returns:
        True if specified cell is active and unoccupied otherwise false.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.

      • isOperatorInValidRange

        boolean isOperatorInValidRange(IOperator operator)
                        throws TError
        Answers whether the operator applied inside of the interval of the board.
        Parameters:
        operator - The object of the operator. Object must not be null otherwise TError is thrown.
        Returns:
        True if the operator is applied inside the interval of the board.
        Throws:
        TError - Thrown if an unrecoverable error was occurred.
